Record Class BoxStyle

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
io.github.lambdaphoenix.simpleterminal.box.BoxStyle
Record Components:
topLeft - the character used for the top-left corner
topRight - the character used for the top-right corner
bottomLeft - the character used for the bottom-left corner
bottomRight - the character used for the bottom-right corner
horizontal - the character used for horizontal lines
vertical - the character used for vertical lines
junctionLeft - the character used for junctions on the left side
junctionRight - the character used for junctions on the right side
junctionHorizontal - the character used for horizontal junction lines
public record BoxStyle(String topLeft, String topRight, String bottomLeft, String bottomRight, String horizontal, String vertical, String junctionLeft, String junctionRight, String junctionHorizontal) extends Record
Represents a visual box style using Unicode or ASCII characters.

A BoxStyle defines the characters used to render borders around boxed content in the console. It includes corner characters, horizontal and vertical lines, and junction characters for separators. Several predefined styles are available, including ASCII, Unicode, double lines,rounded corners, heavy lines, block characters, and minimal spacing.

Usage Example:

BoxStyle style = BoxStyle.ROUNDED;
System.out.println(style.topLeft() + style.horizontal().repeat(10) + style.topRight());
Since:
0.1.0

  • Method Details

    • fromName

      public static BoxStyle fromName(String name)
      Returns a predefined BoxStyle matching the given name.

      The name is case-insensitive. If the name is unknown or null, the ASCII style is returned as a fallback.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the style (e.g. "UNICODE", "DOUBLE", "HEAVY")
      Returns:
      the matching BoxStyle, or ASCII if not found

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:

      Returns:
